metadata.title: CVE-2019-5418 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
There is a File Content Disclosure vulnerability in Action View <5.2.2.1, <5.1.6.2, <5.0.7.2, <4.2.11.1 and v3 where specially crafted accept headers can cause contents of arbitrary files on the target system's filesystem to be exposed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-5418` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actioncable - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionmailbox - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionmailer - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionpack - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actiontext - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionview - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activejob - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activemodel - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activerecord - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activestorage - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activesupport - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-rails - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-railties - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: seth-arnold> In Oneiric-Saucy, rails package is just for transition; The rails package contains actual code from vivid onward

criterions.comment: rails package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
